thread.title: Big bank, tech, health care reports ramp up earnings season
thread.title_full: Big bank, tech, health care reports ramp up earnings season - MarketWatch

author: By     Wallace Witkowski
title: Big bank, tech, health care reports ramp up earnings season
text:
Earnings season kicks off in full force this week as a handful of Dow Jones Industrial Average components report along with several banks and tech companies like Google Inc.
Stocks ended the week virtually flat following a week made volatile by Chinese stocks and Greek bailout concerns. The Dow 30 DJIA, +1.21% gained 0.2%, while the S&P 500 index SPX, +1.23% declined less than 0.1%, and the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +1.53% slipped 0.2%.
S&P 500 earnings are expected to decline by 4.4%, which would be the first decrease in earnings since the third-quarter of 2012, according to Butters.
That, however, is just in the sweet spot for the average lowball for earnings over the past four years. Since 2011, the average underestimation of earnings for the S&P 500 was been 4.5%, according to Birinyi Associates. The first quarter was expected to see a similar earnings drop, only for it eke out a slight gain by the end of the season.
Birinyi Associates Expected loss? No so fast.
